title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message:
Post diode mode reading with black probe at ground too.
Check if you get similar readings on any big coil.

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.

red on ground after bath cleaning 0.45

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message:
Which coils???
I doubt all the coils from MLB give the same readings to ground!
A coil with similar reading like PPBUS_G3H, can denote shorted high-side MOSFET.

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message: i was checking just ppbus coils..

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message:
Do you mean coils directly connected to PPBUS_G3H, why?
Did you expect to get different readings in different points of the same power rail???

With black at ground, you should get OL in diode mode at PPBUS_G3H.
Again, compare with diode mode to ground (both directions) on all big coils from secondary power supplies.
Just for example, L8102, L7700/01, L7600/60, and many more...

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message:
"the board no turn on(fan spin)"
If fan spins, board is turned on.
Don't get confused between turning on and booting!

"first the board no turn on(fan spin) just with the charger only with charger and battery cable with and without battery."
Can you rewrite using corresponding dots and commas?
Help us to understand what you want to say.
Please, post accurate and intelligible information...

I really don't understand what you mean to say about battery and its data cable.

When the board turns on, what is L7211/21/31 voltage?
No need to check on the 3 coils; one is enough.

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.

Probably no short; low values normal for this board.

Try now to put the board in DFU mode.

title: 820-01700 water damage PPBUS_G3H 0.25 dido mode.
message:
When you post the voltage for a power rail, is much more important to know its "end name", than the "PP" header.

There should be something more affected by corrosion.
Compare diode mode readings on LDO rails of all CD3215 chips; each one has 4 LDOs.
Also check if you get 1V1_LDO on the powered port.

Test if board goes into DFU mode.
